sentences.chinese: 嫂厭叔，叔與客來，嫂詳為羹盡，櫟釜，賓客以故去。
sentences.literal: The sister-in-law disliked her husband's younger brother. When he came with guests, she pretended the stew was gone and covered the pot, so the guests left.

sentences.chinese: 已而視釜中尚有羹，高祖由此怨其嫂。
sentences.literal: Later, when they checked the pot, there was still stew left. From this, Gaozu resented his sister-in-law.

sentences.chinese: 即位二十三年卒，子夷王郢立。
sentences.literal: He reigned for twenty-three years and died. His son, King Yi Ying, succeeded him.
King Yi reigned for four years and died. His son, King Wu, succeeded him.

sentences.chinese: 王戊立二十年，冬，坐為薄太后服私姦，削東海郡。
sentences.literal: King Wu reigned for twenty years. In winter, he was convicted of committing adultery while mourning Empress Bo, and Donghai commandery was stripped from him.

sentences.chinese: 春，戊與吳王合謀反，其相張尚、太傅趙夷吾諫，不聽。
sentences.literal: In spring, Wu conspired with the King of Wu to rebel. His chancellor Zhang Shang and tutor Zhao Yiwu advised against it, but he wouldn't listen.

sentences.chinese: 戊則殺尚、夷吾，起兵與吳西攻梁，破棘壁。
sentences.literal: Wu then executed Shang and Yiwu, raised troops, and attacked west with Wu toward Liang, breaking through Jibi.

sentences.chinese: 至昌邑南，與漢將周亞夫戰。
sentences.literal: They reached south of Changyi and fought with the Han general Zhou Yafu.

sentences.chinese: 漢絕吳楚糧道，士卒饑，吳王走，楚王戊自殺，軍遂降漢。
sentences.literal: Han cut off Wu and Chu's supply lines. The soldiers grew hungry. The King of Wu fled. King Wu of Chu committed suicide. The army surrendered to Han.

sentences.chinese: 漢已平吳楚，孝景帝欲以德侯子續吳，以元王子禮續楚。
sentences.literal: After Han pacified Wu and Chu, Emperor Jing wanted to continue Wu with the son of Marquis De, and continue Chu with Prince Yuan's son Liu Li.
Wu was not allowed, but Chu was permitted to establish descendants.

sentences.chinese: 文王立三年卒，子安王道立。
sentences.literal: King Wen reigned for three years and died. His son, King An Dao, succeeded him.

sentences.chinese: 安王二十二年卒，子襄王注立。
sentences.literal: King An reigned for twenty-two years and died. His son, King Xiang Zhu, succeeded him.

sentences.chinese: 襄王立十四年卒，子王純代立。
sentences.literal: King Xiang reigned for fourteen years and died. His son, King Chun, succeeded him.

sentences.chinese: 王純立，地節二年，中人上書告楚王謀反，王自殺，國除，入漢為彭城郡。
sentences.literal: King Chun ascended the throne. In the second year of the Dijie era, a palace attendant submitted a memorial accusing the King of Chu of plotting rebellion. The king committed suicide. The state was abolished and became Pengcheng commandery of Han.
